required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Short- and Long-Term Renal Outcomes Following Lung Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Short- and Long-Term Renal Outcomes Following Lung Transplantation- A Single-Centre Experience

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of acute kidney injury, renal recovery and development of chronic kidney disease in patients undergoing lung transplantation

detailed_description.textblock: It is well described that acute kidney injury and development of chronic kidney disease significantly impact short- and long-term survival after lung transplantation. However, there is limited data about prevalence of kidney disease according to current KDIGO consensus guidelines. It is the aim of this study to describe short- and long-term renal outcomes following lung transplantation. Selected patients who underwent prospective pretransplant renal functional reserve testing with high oral protein load will be analyzed separately in respect to occurrence of acute kidney injury following lung transplantation and development of chronic kidney disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Impact of acute kidney injury (AKI) after lung transplantation on long-term renal function decline.
primary_outcome.description: AKI defined by KDIGO consensus criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of sustained reversal versus non-recovery after AKI on long-term renal function decline after lung transplantation.
secondary_outcome.description: AKI and CKD defined by KDIGO consensus criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk factors associated with development of AKI and CKD after lung transplantation
secondary_outcome.description: AKI and CKD defined by KDIGO consensus criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Whether development of CKD is an independent risk factor for increased rejection rate and death after lung transplantation.
secondary_outcome.description: CKD defined by KDIGO consensus criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between pretransplant renal functional reserve with acute kidney injury after after lung transplantation.
secondary_outcome.description: AKI defined by KDIGO consensus criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between pretransplant renal functional reserve and renal function loss after lung transplantation.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with pretransplant renal functional reserve testing

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with pretransplant renal functional reserve testing

biospec_descr.textblock: Collection of only residual material (blood, urine) was done for Deutsche Zentrum für Lungenforschung Biobank.

study_pop.textblock: All patients undergoing lung transplantation at University Hospital Giessen between 2003 and 2016. Subgroup of patients who underwent pretransplant renal functional reserve testing will be analyzed separately.

criteria.textblock:
For retrospective analysis for all patients undergoing lung transplantation:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Older than 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with eGFR <15ml/min/1.73m2 or with chronic dialysis treatment prior LTx
- Patients undergoing retransplantation and multiorgan transplantation
For prospective study involving patients with pretransplant renal functional reserve testing
Exclusion criteria:
- as above
- unable to perform renal functional reserve testing (e.g., due to critical illness)
- pre-existing acute kidney injury

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospital Giessen and Marburg, Giessen, Department of Internal Medicine II, Division of Pulmonology, Nephrology and Critical Care Medicine

facility.name: University Clinic Giessen and Marburg - Campus Giessen
